Milan are reportedly weighing up a surprise return for Trabzonspor midfielder Juraj Kucka.

According to Corriere dello Sport, Milan will try to bolster their midfield with deals for ‘a mezz’ala with excellent technique and a slightly-more physical player’ this summer.

Consequently, the Rossoneri would have looked at bringing back Kucka to take care of the latter.

The Slovak scored five goals in 67 appearances for the Diavolo in two seasons, before joining Trabzonspor for €6m last summer.

His six assists and three goals – one of which was a lob from the halfway line – helped the Turkish side finish fifth in the Super Lig.

However, the newspaper believes Milan can re-sign the 31-year-old for a ‘much-lower’ fee.

Maldini had 'formed an idea' on Milan

Paolo Maldini implies he saw Milan’s financial difficulties coming, “but we should wait for events at this point and see what happens.”

The club legend had been in negotiations for a role within Yonghong Li’s new Rossoneri project a year ago, but turned it down, telling reporters he was unconvinced by their plans.

Now that UEFA have refused to reach a voluntary or settlement agreement over Financial Fair Play and could throw Milan out of the Europa League, how does he see the situation?

“There are always ups and downs, in sport and any walk of life, so I remember clearly how success was achieved in the past: many times you have to start again.

“At this moment it’s a bit of a struggle, but we’ll see.”

Maldini was asked specifically if he expected all these financial difficulties.

“I had formed a general idea, but we should wait for events at this point and see what happens.”

Balotelli: If I was white…

Mario Balotelli is adamant ‘I’d have had less problems if I was white’ after revealing the shocking extent of the racist abuse he has suffered.

Gazzetta dello Sport published an excerpt of Alessandro Alciato’s book Demoni – or ‘demons’ – where the Italy striker revealed how being black affected his school life and relationship with other children, as well as fans of rival clubs once he became professional.

“Of course, if I was white then I’d have had less problems,” explained the striker, who was also targeted by a discriminatory banner during his Azzurri comeback against Saudi Arabia on Monday.

“I receive so many letters from kids, who consider me an example for never backed down to racism.

“It was disgraceful, having doors slammed in your face for 18 years,” he told Gazzetta dello Sport.

“The doors opened wide after I received [Italian] citizenship, but I was treated the same as before.

“Some snacks had disappeared from desks at school once. [The teachers] immediately thought it was me without investigating.

“However, there’s one incident that I’ll never forget: the tears stopped coming down after that...

“I’d done all my homework. I knew that my mum would let me out to play football. ‘Hi guys, shall we play?’ ‘No Mario, you can’t.’ ‘But I did my homework…’ ‘No Mario, you’re black.

“I was black, therefore I was different in their eyes. I thought they didn’t want me because I was exuberant even back then, but as the years passed, I unfortunately discovered the truth.

“In 2009, I experienced the transition to adulthood in this respect. During a Juventus-Inter game, they called me ‘monkey’, ‘negro’, ‘go back to Africa’ and booed me.

“The second incident happened in June, outside a bar in Rome with my Under-21 teammates.

“While we were chatting, a motorbike emerged from afar and one of the two people riding on it shouted, ‘Negro! Negro Negro!’

“Then they approached me, slowed down and threw a bunch of bananas at me, as if I were a monkey.

“They were also wrong with their aim, hitting the barmaid instead of me.”

香港時間6月1日淩晨《紐約時報》消息，米蘭已被歐洲足協禁止參加新賽季的歐霸盃，原因是違反財政公平法案。

　　歐洲足協對於米蘭的財政問題一直高度關注，前不久他們剛剛否決了米蘭提出的財政自願和解協議。　

　　李勇鴻通過美國洛迪高伊利奧特對衝基金的3億歐元貸款完成了對AC米蘭球會的收購，這筆高息貸款將在10月份償還。

　　李勇鴻面臨的全額還款數字高達3.8億歐元。據《紐約時報》透露，兩名參與貸款過程的工作人員確認，歐洲足協已經決定將米蘭排除出新賽季的歐霸盃比賽。

　　歐洲足協目前還有發佈官方消息，不過《紐約時報》認為此事變數不大。如果米蘭被排除出歐霸盃，阿特蘭大將獲得直接參加小組賽的資格，費倫天拿則將可以參加歐霸盃資格賽。

2018年6月1日，全市場刊登《羅馬體育報》消息，博洛尼亞即將任命恩沙基作為下季教練。

　　《羅馬體育報》稱儘管意乙附加賽尚未打響，博洛尼亞已經同戰績彪炳的威尼斯教練達成一致。自恩沙基入主以來，威尼斯已完成意丁-意乙的兩級跳。如果最終升級成功，威尼斯將同帕爾瑪一起完成偉大的三連跳。　　

　　據悉，博洛尼亞已經開始在轉會市場上為恩沙基謀求心儀的球員，烏甸尼斯的贊圖與國際米蘭的艾達均在收購清單內。

　　歐洲足協對於米蘭的財政問題一直高度關注，前不久他們剛剛否決了米蘭提出的財政自願和解協議。　

　　李勇鴻通過美國洛迪高伊利奧特對衝基金的3億歐元貸款完成了對AC米蘭球會的收購，這筆高息貸款將在10月份償還。

　　李勇鴻面臨的全額還款數字高達3.8億歐元。據《紐約時報》透露，兩名參與貸款過程的工作人員確認，歐洲足協已經決定將米蘭排除出新賽季的歐霸盃比賽。

Multiple sources claim Milan owner Yonghong Li and his business partner Han Li have been in Italy since Tuesday, but did not visit the club headquarters.

According to Sky Sport Italia and La Repubblica, the patron arrived in Milan on Tuesday, but kept his arrival a secret.

It’s not clear why he would do this, but Yonghong Li has not visited the club headquarters or the team’s training ground.

This is a crunch few weeks for the Rossoneri, who were not offered a settlement agreement by UEFA and therefore risk being thrown out of the Europa League for Financial Fair Play violations.

Yonghong Li also had to provide €10m to increase the capital by Monday to prevent Elliott Management taking over the club and it’s reported he has sent the necessary funds.

There is another deadline looming, as he needs €30m by June 15.

More importantly, Yonghong Li must repay the €380m loan to US hedge fund Elliott Management by October or lose the club.

It’s rumoured there is a battle within the Board of Directors between those who want Yonghong Li to maintain control and others who would prefer Elliott take over and find new investors.

Gattuso: ‘Signings must have desire’

Milan Coach Gennaro Gattuso expects this summer’s signings to have the same “desire” of his current squad.

The Rossoneri finished sixth in the season which has just ended, with the former midfielder replacing Vincenzo Montella in November and doing enough to earn a new contract.

“I like the idea of being able to do 10-12 days of pre-season at Milanello,” Gattuso told Milan TV as he looked ahead to next season.

“There are climbs, the forest… plenty of interesting things that can be done here. It’ll be important to put some fuel in our legs because that will be important over a long season.

“I think it’ll be important to work on various formations. We’ll learn the movements of a four-man defence to start with, but in some circumstances I think we can line-up with a three, as well as with a three or four man midfield.

“We have alternatives, and I think that’s important in modern football.

“Our strength? I think it was the group, the desire of the lads and their mentality. I think that’s what we need to start from next season.

“I hope everyone who arrives will have that mentality, because it’ll be crucial. I’ve said many times that an individual can win you a few games, but it’s the team that makes you get to the end.

“We need to start from that mentality and those ideas.

“We have to raise the bar next season, and that starts with pre-season. I only know one way to raise the bar: to work, have desire, and never be satisfied.

“Then I expect more from myself and my staff because we have to be honest: we made some mistakes, whether those were evaluation, technical choices or tactics.

“We have to improve ourselves as well as the players.”

quote.msg:
Gattuso: ‘Signings must have desire’

Milan Coach Gennaro Gattuso expects this summer’s signings to have the same “desire” of his current squad.

The Rossoneri finished sixth in the season which has just ended, with the former midfielder replacing Vincenzo Montella in November and doing enough to earn a new contract.

“I like the idea of being able to do 10-12 days of pre-season at Milanello,” Gattuso told Milan TV as he looked ahead to next season.

“There are climbs, the forest… plenty of interesting things that can be done here. It’ll be important to put some fuel in our legs because that will be important over a long season.

“I think it’ll be important to work on various formations. We’ll learn the movements of a four-man defence to start with, but in some circumstances I think we can line-up with a three, as well as with a three or four man midfield.

“We have alternatives, and I think that’s important in modern football.

“Our strength? I think it was the group, the desire of the lads and their mentality. I think that’s what we need to start from next season.

“I hope everyone who arrives will have that mentality, because it’ll be crucial. I’ve said many times that an individual can win you a few games, but it’s the team that makes you get to the end.

“We need to start from that mentality and those ideas.

“We have to raise the bar next season, and that starts with pre-season. I only know one way to raise the bar: to work, have desire, and never be satisfied.

“Then I expect more from myself and my staff because we have to be honest: we made some mistakes, whether those were evaluation, technical choices or tactics.

“We have to improve ourselves as well as the players.”

Milan meet Monaco

Milan sporting director Massimiliano Mirabelli reportedly met with his Monaco counterpart Michael Emenalo in Turin earlier this week.

The Rossoneri director was pictured in the stands at Juventus Stadium for Italy’s draw with the Netherlands, where it’s believed he was watching Memphis Depay.

However, calciomercato.com reports that Mirabelli also met with Monaco’s sporting director, to discuss André Silva.

The Portuguese striker is keen to make the move to the Ligue 1 side, and Emenalo was informed he’d cost at least €35m.

According to the website, there was no discussion of a potential swap involving Falcao, as had previously been rumoured.

The Rossoneri are still keen on the Colombian, but any deal for the striker would be separate.

Atleti, Sevilla want Suso

Atletico Madrid and Sevilla are reportedly both interested in Milan winger Suso.

The Spaniard signed a new contract with the Rossoneri in September, tying him to the club until 2022.

This morning though the Gazzetta dello Sport reports that two clubs in his homeland are interested in signing Suso.

Atletico Madrid and Sevilla are both said to be keen, but Milan have made it clear they’ll have to pay the €38m release clause.

Silvio Berlusconi’s son brands rumours his father is the power behind the Milan throne as “a joke”.

An investigation by Rai 3 investigative programme Report on Monday looked into the takeover by Yonghong Li, who was financed by US hedge fund Elliott Management.

Report were particularly intrigued by the presence of a company called Blue Skye in the financing of the Milan takeover, as their leaders Gianluca D’Avanzo and Salvatore Cerchione are based in London with very strong links to previous Rossoneri patron Silvio Berlusconi.

They were also both on the Board of Directors of a company called SOPAF with ex-Milan CEO Adriano Galliani.

That has led to suggestions that Il Cavaliere is the real power behind the throne, despite ostensibly selling the club in April 2017.

“I think these rumours are a joke,” Pier Silvio Berlusconi told reporters at the presentation of the Mediaset schedules.

“They make me laugh to say the least. Fininvest has already responded, these rumours are ridiculous. I haven’t spoken with my father about Milan for months.

“I hope Milan can restart with [Gennaro] Gattuso, I think he’s done a great job. That opinion is always half made up of the technical level and the person, but Gattuso was part of our Milan and is a great person.”

Falcao-Silva trade of loans

Mediaset Premium claim Milan and Monaco are very close to agreeing an exchange of loans between Andre Silva and Radamel Falcao.

The reports of a swap deal have been intensifying over the last week.

It now seems as if the clubs are ready to make the trade on a loan basis, most likely with an option to buy.

Agent Jorge Mendes is the architect behind the move after Andre Silva rejected a more lucrative transfer to Wolverhampton Wanderers or even Huddersfield.

An exchange of loans would allow Milan to spend no money on the deal, bring in a player with a great deal of experience and determination, while allowing Andre Silva to play regularly and gain some confidence.

Al-Falasi new Milan investor?

Saeed Al-Falasi is again being linked with Milan, this time purchasing 30 per cent as a minority shareholder to help prop up Yonghong Li.

According to Oracolo Rossonero, the figure ready to buy 30 per cent of the San Siro side is the owner of International Triangle Group.

There had already been strong reports in La Gazzetta dello Sport of a possible takeover bid in March, but at the time, Yonghong Li rejected all offers.

After UEFA refused to seal a settlement agreement with the club over Financial Fair Play problems and threatened to exclude Milan from the Europa League, the situation has changed.

Yonghong Li has until October to pay the full €380m loan – including interest – to Elliott Management or lose control of the club.

Even before then, he has to pay up €32m to increase the capital by the end of June to keep them ticking over.

It was allegedly Al-Falasi and not Elliott Management who approached Paolo Maldini to enter the club hierarchy this week, a story that Elliott denied through news agency ANSA.

That is because Al-Falasi used Maldini’s friend Riccardo Silva as a broker for the deal.

Silva and Maldini worked together to set up NAFL franchise Miami FC.

Verdi books Napoli medical

Simone Verdi is expected to undergo his Napoli medical tomorrow, completing the €25m transfer from Bologna.

According to the latest reports from Mediaset Premium, Verdi has been booked in to Rome’s Villa Stuart clinic on Monday morning.

The 25-year-old winger will then sign a five-year contract, which is not thought to include any release clauses.

Winger and free kick specialist Verdi scored 10 goals with 10 assists for Bologna during the current campaign.

Milan are also set to profit, because as part of the move to Bologna, they retained a percentage of any future sale.

It’s believed they will pocket €5m from Verdi’s transfer.

Milan consider Castillejo

Milan see Villarreal’s Samu Castillejo as an ideal replacement if Suso leaves, according to reports.

Suso has a release clause in his contract, which is believed to be worth around €50m and only valid for foreign clubs.

It’s not clear if the Spaniard wants to leave, but the Rossoneri don’t want to be caught out if someone does activate his clause.

As a result, reports Gianluca Di Marzio’s website, they are looking at Castillejo as a potential replacement.

The 23-year-old has similar features to Suso, and like all Spanish players has a release clause in his contract.

It’s not clear the value of that clause, but Milan could use Carlos Bacca to lower the fee they’d have to pay.

The striker spent the last season on loan with Villarreal, but the Liga side are not keen to pay the €15.5m it would take to sign him permanently.

The Diavolo could therefore offer the Colombian as part of a deal to get Castillejo.

The new shareholder could be an American. Today, there has been importants meetings in Milano for documentations which could prove to be agreements regarding the shareholder role. Those documentations has been sent to a notary office in Rome. [@sole24ore]

The American shareholder would arrive as a minority shareholder, and he would also provide Yonghong Li with €32M for the last capital increase, which has a deadline on June the 30th. [@sole24ore]

The advisors of the American investor, Goldman Sachs, are currently in Milano, where they arrived from London today, to define the agreement between the parties. [@sole24ore]

The future for Yonghong Li could be similar to Erick Thorir's at Inter: First arrive as a majority shareholder, then be relegated to a minority shareholder, with rights and contacts in the Asian market [@sole24ore]

In addition to the American and Malaysian interest, there's also an Arab group who is interested in the minority shareholder role at Milan. Yonghong Li will choose a decision shortly, but it depends on the higgest bidder. [Sky]
